title: (x) Happy New Year - lettering {Eduardo}
content:
Hello,   
Can anyone please tell me the name of this font,I have searched every where and all I have gotten is a huge headache. Any help would be Greatly appreciated.. Thank You   
 Linda   
 ![mystery Card Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142053im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23953.jpg)
author: linda32174

comments.content: It's not a font, it's a lettering job.

You aren't the only one who's been looking for that 'font'. I saw numerous posts for it on alt.binaries.fonts, and someone else sent me a sample to ID a few days ago. Do you notice how the identical letters (like E and A) don't look the same each time they appear? That's the biggest clue that this is artwork. Another point is all the contour details on the letters themselves, with variable shading that you can't get from Photoshop or any other type-styling app I know. The last point is the completely outrageous 'baroque' swashes would be nearly impossible to make work in a digital font, although I know many fonts have swash character sets. These are beyond almost anything I can think of for complexity.

Thank You Eduardo & Yves   
It was Sent to me in hopes I could find some sort of answer.. And Thanks too the two of you I now Have it :o))And Thank You Yves for The site maybe I can find her something close to it there..

You might also look at [Escrita from T-26](%20http://www.typophile.com/cgibin/show.pl?83/23947) or their wild font [Bacchus](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142053/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/bacchus/) which has one of the most flamboyant swashes. Also Scriptorium's [John Speed](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142053/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/john-speed/) is beyond wild.
